data.event: Part of the Connecticut Western Reserve, Kent was settled in 1805 and was known for many years as Franklin Mills.
Part of the Connecticut Western Reserve, Kent was settled in 1805 and was known for many years as Franklin Mills.
In 1864 the town was renamed Kent in honor of and in gratitude for Marvin Kent's efforts.

event.title: was incorporated as a village in 1867

data.event: It was incorporated as a village in 1867 and became a city after the 1920 Census.
It was incorporated as a village in 1867 and became a city after the 1920 Census.

event.title: Today Kent is a college town best known

data.event: Today Kent is a college town best known as the home of the main campus of Kent State University, founded in 1910, and as the site of the 1970 Kent State shootings.
Today Kent is a college town best known as the home of the main campus of Kent State University, founded in 1910, and as the site of the 1970 Kent State shootings.
